section.section: The Secretary shall establish and promote a statewide public information program on acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).

The public information program shall:
Attempt to reach individuals at risk for contracting AIDS;
Encourage those individuals at risk for contracting AIDS to take the necessary precautions to prevent transmission of the HTLV-III virus; and
Include any other aspects that the Secretary considers appropriate.

text.section:
The Secretary shall establish a program to train physicians, physician's assistants, nurses, and other health professionals in:
Diagnosing and treating AIDS or other conditions associated with AIDS; and
Methods to prevent the transmission of the HTLV-III virus.

To carry out this section, the Secretary:
On request, shall receive the help of or information from any agency of this State or of a political subdivision; and
May contract for any necessary services.
The Secretary may set a sliding fee schedule for services provided under this section.
